New Records: Jackson Chourio is the second-youngest player in postseason history with a multi-homer game at 20 years and 205 days, older than only Andruw Jones.
Chourio is the second player in AL/NL history to hit two game-tying homers in the same postseason game, the other being Babe Ruth in Game Four of the 1928 World Series.
Chourio became the second rookie with multiple game-tying or go-ahead homers in a postseason game, the first being Evan Longoria in Game One of the 2008 ALDS.
This was the first time the Brewers have won a postseason game in which they trailed entering the seventh inning since Game Four of the 1982 World Series.
Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio homered twice for the Brewers, tying the game both times.
Garrett Mitchell hit the go-ahead home run in the eighth inning.
Francisco Lindor made two notable defensive plays in the second and fifth innings.
Francisco Alvarez gunned down Garrett Mitchell as he tried to steal second in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised the team's resilience and contributions from multiple players.
Carlos Mendoza expressed confidence in the Mets' ability to bounce back for Game Three.
Garrett Mitchell highlighted Willy Adames' leadership and clutch performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers' relief pitchers combined to pitch 5 1/3 scoreless innings, allowing only two hits and three walks.
The Mets left nine men on base, seven in scoring position, missing opportunities to extend their lead.
Phil Maton allowed four hits in the eighth inning, resulting in the Brewers' comeback.
Others: The decisive third game of the series will be played on Thursday at American Family Field, with Brewers right-hander Tobias Myers facing Mets lefty Jose Quintana.
